intro: Anaphalioides mariae, commonly known as the Marie's ghost flower, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, white to pale yellow flowers that resemble tiny ghosts, hence its common name. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, inconspicuous seeds in its flower heads. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Anaphalioides mariae is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific ecological conditions for successful growth and reproduction.
